cause.description:
The Women's Sexual Assault Center located in downtown Victoria offer a number of services that with the purpose of preventing sexual assault against women from occurring. The Victoria Women's Sexual Assault center provides many programs that women can use. The Sexual Assault Response Team (SART) within the Women's Sexual Assault Center provide information and options to women who have been assaulted, in assisted them about reporting to the police. Counseling for grief-stricken women or women experiencing trauma is also available. Other services other than the SART are the 24 Hour Crisis & Information Line (emotional support and information for women who have been sexually assaulted), Specialized Victim Services Program (support for women who have survived an attack and wish to seek criminal justice system involvement), Project Respect (a volunteer program for people ages 14-19 who work together to promote respect for relationships to remain healthy and safe for women).
1. Sexual violence against women needs to stop.
2. Female victims of assault need to be aware about the information and options available to them.
cause.mission: Work to prevent sexual assault against women.
cause.name: Victoria Women's Sexual Assault Society
